gw.plugin.security

Interface AuthenticationServicePlugin

  • All Superinterfaces:
    com.guidewire.pl.system.integration.plugins.internal.InternalPlugin, java.rmi.Remote

    public interface AuthenticationServicePlugin
extends com.guidewire.pl.system.integration.plugins.internal.InternalPlugin
    The authentication service plugin is used to authorize a user from AuthenticationSource data. It is up to the implementation how to do this; however, the following contract must be observed.
    • The service must handle the UserNamePasswordAuthenticationSource class. This class contains a username and password combination. By obeying this rule, all external services will be able to authenticate using a username and password.
    • All modifications to the user record must be done using the AuthenticationServicePluginCallbackHandler object. This callback allows you to query for the user, modify the user, and modify relationships of the user (such as its role or group.).

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String authenticate(AuthenticationSource source)
      Authenticates the source information and returns the user public ID for the user described in the source.
      void setCallback(AuthenticationServicePluginCallbackHandler callbackHandler)
      Sets the callback handler for this service.

    • Method Detail

      • authenticate

        java.lang.String authenticate(AuthenticationSource source)
                              throws javax.security.auth.login.LoginException
        Authenticates the source information and returns the user public ID for the user described in the source. Implementations of this service should use the callback handler provided in the setCallback method to query or modify the user object.
        Parameters:
        source - The authentication source.
        Returns:
        The application user public ID for the user that is authenticated, or null.
        Throws:
        javax.security.auth.login.LoginException

      • setCallback

        void setCallback(AuthenticationServicePluginCallbackHandler callbackHandler)
        Sets the callback handler for this service. The callback can be used to perform operations in the server through the plugin interface. This method is called by the system to pass a callback handler to the plugin. The plugin can then use this handler to call back into the server.

        The typical implemenation of this method is to store the callback handler variable as a class variable in the plugin. This callback would then be used in the authentication method.

        Parameters:
        callbackHandler -
        See Also:
        AuthenticationServicePluginCallbackHandler
